result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly M Hallio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $2,500.00 to be paid to Cincinnati Insurance as a condition of probation.

Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Court costs waived.

No contact with victim.  No contact with Country Springs Hotel.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Stipulation filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kimberly M Hallio in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Recommendations by the State.  Victim appears by phone and makes statement.  Arguments by the Defense.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld
- 2 years Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- Restitution of $2,500.00 to be paid to Cincinnati Insurance as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  No contact with victim.  No contact with Country Springs Hotel.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
CONDITION TIME: 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Parties have come to an agreement to amend Court 1 to receiving stolen property.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  No objection by the State.  Court grants request and cancels jury trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
